title: Improve admin access to the stored user information (Internet Identity help + principal visibility)

requirements.text: Add a new admin-help page/route that explains how the website owner can access the admin-only user information using Internet Identity, including a clear link to the Internet Identity management page and step-by-step instructions in English.

quotes: Okay, then all user's information should be forwarded to create another site that can be accessed by the admin alone from here. Then all the information should be forwarded to that site. Then you should give me access to the site

acceptanceCriteria: A new route exists (not linked from the public header) that displays a professional help page for the owner/admin explaining how to access the admin-only user list using Internet Identity.
The page includes a clearly visible external link to https://id.ai/manage (or the configured Internet Identity provider URL if already present in configuration).
All user-facing text on this page is in English.
Navigating to this page uses the existing global route-transition UX (spinner + fade-in).

requirements.text: Update the admin access gating UI so that when a logged-in user is denied admin access, the page displays the currently authenticated Internet Identity Principal and clear instructions that the website owner must set this Principal as the configured admin Principal for access.

quotes: I cannot access them due to my own enablement of being able to access my internet ID. I don't know what that is. I don't know how to access that.

acceptanceCriteria: When a user is authenticated but not an admin, the Access Denied view shows the user’s current Principal as text (e.g., "Your Principal: …").
The Access Denied view includes English instructions telling the owner where the admin Principal is configured (frontend config) and that it must match the shown Principal.
If the identity is not available, the UI does not crash and does not display a misleading principal value.
The Admin Login flow and denial screen continue to participate in the existing global route-transition UX for any in-app navigation actions.

requirements.text: Ensure the owner-only admin page for viewing stored user accounts remains available as the private destination for submitted user information, and ensure it is accessible only after Internet Identity login and admin authorization.

quotes: create another site that can be accessed by the admin alone from here. Then all the information should be forwarded to that site.

acceptanceCriteria: The admin-only user list route (e.g., /users) remains protected so anonymous users are prompted to log in and non-admin authenticated users are denied.
After successful signup flows already in the app, created accounts continue to be persisted in the backend and appear in the admin user list (name + email at minimum).
The backend admin-only listing API continues to reject non-admin callers.
The admin user list UI does not display sensitive fields (e.g., passwords) even if the backend record contains them.

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Do not implement automatic forwarding of user-entered data to Telegram, email, or any external service.
Do not add admin-only pages to the public header/navigation.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), or frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; add migration only if state changes require it.
nonGoals: Collecting SSN or forwarding SSN/passwords to Telegram/email.
Replacing the existing public signup/plan flow with a new multi-step SSN-based flow.
Adding third-party authentication beyond Internet Identity.
Adding external databases or external admin dashboards hosted outside this app.
